measure.CatchLine: Amends Housing and Community Services Department's distribution of Emergency Housing Account funds and administration of federal anti-poverty programs.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Amends Housing and Community Services Department's distribution of Emergency Housing Account funds and administration of federal anti-poverty programs. 
	Establishes Task Force on Homelessness and Racial Disparities to address provision of and access to homeless services. Requires task force to submit report to appropriate committee of Legislative Assembly no later than January 15, 2022. Sunsets task force July 1, 2022. 
	Declares emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to housing; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to housing; and declaring an emergency.
measure.AtTheRequestOf: (at the request of Governor Kate Brown for Housing and Community Services Department)

sponsors.PresessionFiledMessage: Introduced and printed pursuant to House Rule 12.00.  Presession filed

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Recommendation: Do pass with amendments, be printed A-Engrossed, and be referred to Ways and Means.
Referred to Ways and Means by order of Speaker.
Assigned to Subcommittee On Transportation and Economic Development.
Third reading. Carried by Campos. Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 45; Nays, 14--Bonham, Breese-Iverson, Cate, Drazan, Levy, Lewis, Moore-Green, Morgan, Post, Reschke, Smith DB, Stark, Wallan, Weber.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to President's desk.
Recommendation: Do pass with amendments to the A-Eng. bill to resolve conflicts. (Printed B-Eng.)
Third reading.  Carried by Jama.  Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 20; Nays, 9--Boquist, Findley, Girod, Heard, Linthicum, Patterson, Robinson, Thatcher, Thomsen; Excused, 1--Manning Jr.

historyActions.ActionText: Vote explanation(s) filed by Heard, Patterson.
House concurred in Senate amendments and repassed bill.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 43; Nays, 13--Bonham, Breese-Iverson, Cate, Drazan, Levy, Lewis, Moore-Green, Morgan, Post, Reschke, Stark, Wallan, Wright; Excused, 1--Smith G; Excused for Business of the House, 2--Clem, Smith DB.
